caption: The ambience is great, the customer service is great and the food is the best!
Excellent food, service and ambiance.
Good food with southern menu. Not particularly to my taste. Your taste might be different.

This place was amazing.  It did not disappoint.  Exceeded expectations. I ate all the food. service was quick. The atmosphere was beautiful. Loved the art on the walls, music that was played. Our waiter was amazing. If you visit ask for Jose as your waiter.
The food and service are both outstanding. I've eaten at virtue four times, it's one of my favorite restaurants.
Wow! Outstanding food and service! Taylor was our server and she was awesome! Fantastic place!
The most overrated, over priced food on the Southside of Chicago.

We booked for a first experience for Saint Valentines day. Recently installed in Chicago, we’ve heard about Virtue for a while way before we moved here and we liked the team’s background and the fact that they made effort to reopen the indoor service. As often for those special occasions only two imposed menues were offered. Generally, imposed menue are not the best to rank a restaurant but regarding the reduced offer of tables because of covid, I made my decision hoping that the Menu composition would meet the reputation. The oysters were great and new to me, although not very sustainable with this amount of not recycled salt. The cooking point was surprising and we did feel the southern influence in the seasoning. The salad was probably one of the biggest disappointment of the last 24 months for the standing of the place. I could have done better with my fridge left overs.. The main plates were good but pretty standards. I was weird out that the waitress was surprised when I asked if the Filet Mignon was Pork since it is the main used meat in the country where the dish comes from. Beef it was, good quality but again, nothing mind blowing, we were looking for the thing that was supposed to make this place special. Big thumb up for the pastry chef, great Cheesecake and one of the best chocolate truffles I had for a while. This saved the diner. We would be willing to try this restaurant again but with the possibility to choose à la carte options and with a high expectation to find what made this place a big deal.
Our server was amazing. The collards were intoxicating. Will be back

Amazing service. Our server was extremely knowledgeable and made some great suggestions for both our food and cocktails. The drinks were all really unique and tasty. The food combined old school soul food with some nice modern twists. Most of all, the owner/manager Jesus was one of the gracious and kind people that I have ever met while dining out.

A little late in posting this review, but when the place we usually get our smoked turkey for Thanksgiving burned down, I was left scrambling for a bird two weeks out. To say Virtue delivered would be an understatement. The entire family declared it the best turkey we had ever eaten. I know a to-go turkey isn’t a regular menu item, but if their food and service are as good as it was in this experience, then this is an incredible place. I cannot wait to eat there after the pandemic.

It doesn’t  matter how good the food is, if the customer service is horrific. My friends and I arrived to the restaurant and after we were seated, we ordered drinks. Before we could finish our first round, the waiter brought the check without even asking if we wanted another round, if we wanted water or if we were done ordering altogether. (We did notice folks of other skin color being served with more diligence) While we took offense to this, as we felt like we were being rushed and unattended to, we still stayed against our better judgement. We had $100 gift certificate that we wanted to use for our $60 meal. (We ordered appetizers for the most part) After calling the manager from the back and having what seemed like a 15 minute meeting, we were told by the waiter that the gift certificate would be honored. (As if they weren’t the establishment that sold the gift certificate to begin with.) and then the manager (a white male) had the audacity to tell us that the tip was not included. As if that’s not common knowledge. We are a group of young BLACK SUCCESSFUL women... and you don’t think we have the least bit of  common sense to know that we have to leave a tip? And he didn’t even mention the balance left on the gift certificate, didn’t ask if we wanted to order more drinks.. didn’t ask how the food was. Nothing. Just walked off. Needless to say.... This place is ghetto..would not recommend.
Great food and atmosphere. Very clean and they followed all Covid-19 safety guidelines. The staff was awesome as well and can’t forget the yummy cornbread.

All the food is delicious!! I mean everything on the menu! The gizzards are super tender! Never had gizzards so tender. And somebodys mama is in there making that macaroni! Its THAT good!! Beef short ribs, fried green tomatoes, Salmon, catfish everything is out of sight!!!😋😋😋
I tried their short ribs, shrimp and chocolate cake. It was good but I was not amazed.

Pleasantly surprised by the whole experience. The hostess Chasty was beyond personable and welcoming upon entering the establishment. I was treated to the half chicken with raisins and lemon pepper seasoning with sweet potatoes and brussel sprouts with a Ebony and Ivory cake for dessert. It was perfect, amazing artwork as well.
The atmosphere and the food are great.

We had an excellent dinner at Virtue last night! Even considering the COVID-19 protocols, it was a great night out. The service was excellent and the team is clearly proud of their work. The bartender even came over to ask our thoughts on two new cocktails and he was clearly gushing with pride. Not-to-mention the food was stellar and homey! We had three courses including the Green tomatoes with shrimp, BBQ Pork Steak, Fried Catfishand finished the night with the best banana pudding.

So, a local radio station turned me on to this joint (although technically I now reside in another state) and I'm very glad they did. The vibe here is intimate & trendy with soothing music piped in. As restaurants go I'll just say that it's size is relatively small although one must consider that the other side is dedicated just to the bar area alone. I reserved a spot for the Sunday evening b4 Christmas and it was crowded which is to be expected with a hot new eatery especially being located in Hyde Park. If you are familiar with the area then you know parking can be (and usually is) a nightmare but there are parking lots available around the corner. Upon entering, the wait time was less than 5 minutes which was appreciated considering I did have a reservation.

My family orderd for the Christmas Holiday. Braised short ribbs, mac&cheese, Collard Greens, dinner rolls, and  Red Velvet Vake. Everything was delicious!  It was delivered on time and packaged very orderly and came with directions. Maybe for another upcoming holiday, we will order something again.

Ordered a nice dinner for the husband's birthday; he truly could not decide what he liked best. Short rib, collards, broccoli, banana pudding. Amazing. I had the cauliflower and was very pleased with the vegetarian offerings. Can't wait to visit in person when things reopen.

I think this place is fine, a little pricey. A few of the dishes I tried were not super impressive - not bad, just not very interesting in my opinion. I think they could afford to go a bit harder on flavor and seasoning.
Absolutely delicious!  The cornbread is super good and their salmon is extremely tasty and fresh. Love this place!

The coffee was good, the inside was well lit with natural lighting and very homey feeling and I loved the layout. The parking lot is a little small but appropriate to the amount of seating indoors. There is a drive-thru, but I haven't ordered coffee through their yet.

I just received a call at 9 pm the night before Thanksgiving from Shelby at Virtue that my items won’t be available because they weren’t supposed to be selling “a la carte” items. Really?? The day before Thanksgiving?? It’s also disingenuous because they’re quoted in a November 19th Chicago Tribune article emphasizing that “A la carte menu also available.” for thanksgiving orders — so which is it?? Really poor business practices.

I ordered some cornbread that serves 2 people for $16 and what they call an apple pie.  I'm really unsatisfied what what I paid for. If I would have known I never would have come here, plus it took an hour to pick up my sides tonight.  I'll need to go out somewhere else to supplement.
Great food and great people
Best restaurant in the city
ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The food here is well worth the visit. Should note that the Mac and cheese serving can feed two people. My group was pleased and we can't wait to visit again. LOVE IT

We have eaten at the restaurant on three occasions. While the food was good, the portions were  way too small for the price. We would love to continue to patronize them but would love for th em to increase their portion sizes on food and drinks. It’s a shame we spent over $175 on one half bake chicken, one short ribs, one catfish entrees, one side of macaroni, greens, cornbread and two  fried green tomatoes and was still Hungry after we finished eating.People don’t mind paying extra as long as when you’re finished with your meal you are not still Hungry. Very Disappointed!!!!

Can't recommend this place more highly. The food is delicious, sophisticated without being fussy, the drinks match the vibe. The service is great. It's a special place with a warm atmosphere the best food we've had in Chicago since moving from London. Go before it's too hard to get a reservation. And the heaters made eating outside on Nov 12 possible!

I've eaten takeout on two different occasions and if the food is this so darn delicious takeout I can't imagine dining in.  The food is fresh, and seasoned to perfection. I had collards, mac n cheese, sooo cheesy, and cornbread that taste like mom's only better!! The cheesy grits were smooth buttery with a hint of green onion, I could eat them for breakfast, lunch or dinner. I thought I was in New Orleans eating gumbo, spicy, meaty, heavenly. I can't say enough about Virtue, I can't wait to be able to experience indoor dining. Don't wait, the food is a total experience on its own!! 10 stars**********
Amazing spot!
A must if you're in Hyde Park
I love how creative the menu is and how absolutely delicious everything is.  The half chicken is amazing, the thigh was the best bite of food I've had in a long time. So many amazing flavors.

Chefs,cooks PLEASE wear gloves, Great job with Everyone wearing Masks and checking guests temps please keep in mind there Are A sympathetic people mingling among us. I was going to try this restaurant but after seeing food being touched with no gloves....
FOOD WAS GREAT AND WORTH EVERY PENNY,NICE PEOPLE AND EVERYTHING

Went for the first time with my husband and everything was great. Portions are great sizes and everything was delicious. Great service from the time we walked in until the time we departed. Freddy was the waiter and he was great. He made recommendations and was very knowledgeable about what the restaurant had to offer. Will definitely be back to try other things on the menu.

This place is awesome. Southern comfort food at its best! The food is DELICIOUS! The service was awesome, we had an awesome waitress that knew all about the menu. Get to Virtue, you won't be disappointed!
Amazing food with great service! When you go there, get the amazingly tender prime rib. It's great and is like heaven on Earth!
Banana pudding
The food was amazing and the service was excellent
Excellent! Great food, good atmosphere a must try.
Food was great. Anesthetics not so much. No tablecloths.

Food was great. Loved the gumbo; collard greens; fried green tomatoes; cheddar grits. Staff was very professional and friendly.  Comfortable inside.  But we did not appreciate the plastic water bottles automatically placed at our table; we requested plain glasses of water.    From an environmental standpoint the plastic waste this generates is problematic.  Clearly, a lot of thought, work and planning happens here. Would you consider a more environmentally friendly option rather than the disposable water bottles?  Thanks!
From the decor to the service it was perfect. Then we had a few craft drinks. Absolutely fantastic. My boyfriend and I had one of the most comforting and Delicious meals ever.

Unbelievable establishment with unpretentious, but very thoughtful dishes. Everything from the wine list to the beautiful serving ware you can tell were picked with great care. Can’t wait to come back for a bigger meal, we just stopped in for gumbo and pie and wow oh wow :) lovely staff and ambiance complement the equally lovely food
Had a great time.  My kids took me there for my 51st birthday...

Go eat here. Anyone who keeps there staff on while every other restaurant is laying people off just shows you how special chef Williams is. Thank you for showing people what good people look and act like. May god shine down on you.

The restroom 🚻 is amazing! AMAZING!  Our waiter is a LOVE BUG! The drinks are extravagant!  I think I've fallen in love 😍.  Okay really quick.  This is true soulfood! Food is my life and how I pay my bills, but I would gladly eat this food every day 😋.  Greens taste like grandma made them this morning.  Cabbage on point, mac and cheese fire 🔥,  fried green tomatoes with dill shrimp BABY, THE MOFO CHICKEN!  Stop by and enjoy a little soulfood heaven! OKRA is one of the comfort foods i grew up eating and it was DELICIOUS 😋.

Food was excellent. Some of the best food I’ve had in awhile. Service was great. I woke up at 5am to polish off my Mac and cheese and greens (cold) that’s how good it was lol. Also had the broccoli, fried green tomatoes, gumbo, cornbread. Oh my word. Just GOOD
Excellent meal, great atmosphere,  must visit!
Absolutely wonderful

We both had the over priced beef short ribs which were very dry. Will not get those again. The mashed potatoes & creamed spinach were good. The gizzards were a good appetizer & the service was very good, which is why I gave 3 stars.
Food was excellent.  Atmosphere same!
Staff are doing a great job during the pandemic, and the food is excellent.

Love love love!!! Freddy was absolutely the friendliest server in the world, the Sazerac was smooth and delicious, I devoured the catfish, and the tartare was everything. Virtue is doing COVID right; this is the only restaurant I've been to doing temperature checks. Bottled water was given rather than tap and poured; loved everything about all the steps being taken. Please make sure to come out and support!
Not sure why they allowed a reservation for a time that they were suppose to close. Things felt a little rushed but waiter was good and knowledgable.  We enjoyed  the "1810" and "strawberry fields"

Greens, cornbread with the honey butter, fried green tomatoes topped with shrimp, mac and cheese, blackened fish, short ribs...you name it.  Virtue is the spot to try, they will not disappoint. Safety was first on the menu, before we entered to dine inside, our temperatures were checked then we were escorted to our table. Our party of six experienced great service, socially distant dining, attentive staff and exceptionally amazing food. We ordered different entrées but each couple gravitated towards the cornbread, greens and macaroni and cheese. The sides alone will fill you up and the portions are pretty sizable so you can share...if you're in the sharing mood. The short ribs were tender, shrimp and grits were amazing and the fish entrées seasoned well and cooked to perfection. We enjoyed every bite and had a little leftover to relive the experience all over again with leftovers the next day. We didn't leave room for dessert but if we had we would've went with the banana pudding. I enjoyed my mocktail, the hummingbird but our friends didn't love their cocktails as much one felt the basil in the drink was a little overpowering. Our tab was about $277 with gratuity and everyone left with full bellies and praises. Even the usually picky ones of our party that always order chicken fried hard or the one that questions whether each dish has pork or beef added for flavoring. Virtue managed to please them all.

Great restaurant. It's elevated soul food that tastes as good as your down south aunt's. Even with limited service during the pandemic, the quality has maintained it's high standards. Outdoor dinner reservations accepted starting at 4pm. Diners are allowed 90 minutes to make way for other patrons which is understandable since they can't utilize every table. The service is good and so are the cocktails! I wish Hyde Park would close the street to allow more outdoor dining and give Virtue more space.

What a gem.  The ambiance is great at the restaurant, but more importantly the food itself is ace. Creative menu of southern classics including blackened catfish, fried gizzards, greens, etc. My two favorite things I've had: a porkchop special I had 2 weeks ago that was so large it made two meals, and their incredible banana pudding.  Full disclosure, I last ate there in person 8 months ago. Since then I have only gotten takeout. It's hard to capture the magic of an upscale restaurant with takeout, but somehow they manage to do it.

It was painfully apparent that at Virtue Restaurant and Bar every patron is not created equal.  On August 27th at 7:30 pm I brought a guest to Virtue for a birthday dinner.  During these challenging times, it is very important to me to support local businesses and especially black-owned businesses.  When we arrived we were seated immediately, before being seated our temperature was taken and that made me more comfortable with coming out during these challenging times.  When my waiter came to the table he told us that Chicago requires masks until drinks and food are served.  We were specifically told as staff “we can’t even talk to you without a mask” we were sitting in the outdoor patio and we compiled, but as I looked around many couples and families didn’t have on a mask.  Our bottled water came, and within 5 minutes we were approached by another gentleman that we later found to be the general manager (I confirmed that by looking at his picture on the restaurant website).  The GM began to give us a 5-minute speech on how we are required to wear masks.  I was drinking water at the time.  I asked are you telling me I need to wear this mask in between sips and his response was yes.  I again complied and just wanted to salvage the evening.  Here is when the experience was ruined. It was a beautiful night in Chicago so I asked the hostess if she could take a picture of my guest and me with my cell phone.  I was told that she would only take our picture if we wore out masks during the picture.  I asked could she stand 6 feet away to take the picture without the mask and she refused, we declined the picture.  Sitting next to us was a couple that never wore a mask.  Not only did they never wear but it was obvious they were VIPs to the manager and staff.  For the next 30 minutes, we watched staff member after staff member come and greet these guest. NO MASK for the patron, not only did they talk to the guest they embraced him.  Holding long conversations without social distancing, this was not one staff member I counted at least 9 different Virtue staff.  I brought this to the attention of my server and they said everyone was happy to see him and we know him.  I explain my position that every customer should be treated the same.  With over 170,000 deaths in the US, I have no problem with a reasonable request for COVID safety but they should apply to everyone.  I asked to speak to the manager and once it was brought to his attention he could not dispute what I was observing.  That he and his staff applied the COVID protocol to who they wanted to when they wanted to.  The general manager apologized but changed nothing.  After our conversation, he stood within 5 feet of these “SPECIAL” customers and continued to watch his staff, talk, laugh, and physically embrace these patrons. My stomach turned with frustration with this clear lack of consistency and I no longer was interested in my meal.  For my $90 meal, I was told that I needed to wear my mask in between sips of water, I was given a 5-minute speech on why we must follow the safety rules, told by staff they couldn’t even talk to me without a mask, and that they couldn’t snap a quick picture of my guest and me from a safe distance. All of this within the first 20 minutes of my visit. Virtue does not treat every customer the same.  Safety in these COVID times is very important. Patrons have a responsibility to protect each other by wearing a mask.  As a mental health first responder, I understand this better than most.  But, Virtue also has a responsibility to its customers.  Treat every customer the same, follow the city protocol, hold your staff accountable, and use some common-sense practices as we all work through these challenging times. My plan is not to go to Virtue again.  What I am requesting is a phone call from the owner to further share my point of view on my experience.

1st time experience at this trendy restaurant in Hyde Park area for my Birthday and it will be my last. Let's start with what went well. They required masks, and did a temperature check upon arrival. We made reservations for outdoor seating. That was prompt. We were told by the hostess and then the server not to remove our masks until we were sat and received our drinks or food. That was fine and we had experienced this at other venues during these new Covid times. We were asked by a third staff if we wanted water. We said yes, and received bottled water. Now I'm not sure about you, but I haven't mastered drinking water through my mask. And last time I checked it qualified as a drink. We removed our masks and started drinking our water. We immediately received a visit from the general manager. We didn't understand why he was at our table and didn't find out until later that he was the manager. When he came to the table he asked us to put our mask on and said he could not even continue to speak to us without a mask. We complied. He then proceeded to tell us again that we must wear our masks. He was very lengthy and had the reasons down. My partner asked how were we to drink our waters and that we were told once seated and received our drinks and food we could remove masks. He said that we must drink our water and then return our masks. Now I want to explain that this was in the 1st 10-15 minutes at most within this restaurant. Yet, upon arrival, during this interaction and within the interior of the restaurant, this rule did not apply to everyone. We saw non-compliance happening with the staff, hostess, and chef as they greeted people and even hugged people with out masks that they apparently knew. These customers had not been served food yet and also only had drinks and/or water. But, we listened to the manager, put on our masks between sips of water, at our outside table,  and waited to order our food and drinks. The menu is a twist on Southern cuisine and had selections like Gizzards and Dirty Rice, Gumbo, Catfish and collard greens. Food options are by plate size, small or large. And the sides are a la carte and presented as an option to have as a shareable appetizer. They have a wine menu to pair with the food. We had the shrimp and grits and salmon and corn entrees with a side of cornbread. We ordered two cocktails. The food was tasty.  The mini, and yes I said mini,  cocktails were cute and delicious, but small. Overall the food was tasty, was it fantastic- NO. For the price, it is expected for Hyde Park restaurants. The service and inconsistency with the guidelines is my biggest takeaway. We asked the host if she could take a picture of us at the table at a safe distance. Because it was a nice evening. She replied, only if we put on our masks. We thanked her and said never mind. Remember I said earlier I saw her speak with guests leaving and coming into the restaurant without their masks on and stood in very close proximity to her. After observing all of these things, we explained our concerns to our waiter and asked for the manager.  By this time we were turned off, and we were no longer hungry and picked at our food as we continued to observe staff interacting with customers without masks. The gentleman that came to our table earlier revealed he was the manager. This time he did not ask us to place our masks on before  he explained that he heard our concerns  and apologized. He explained that one of the guest at a nearby table was an old friend and that the staff was excited to see him. We explained that may be, but there were other occurrences of it happening and that within our 1st few minutes and throughout the evening we had been approached and reminded to mask up. So to see the staff blatantly bend the rules when they wanted was disappointing. We asked for our check soon after this conversation since we were dissatisfied with the experience. Our final straw was that the staff lingered at the host station as we left and did not thank us for coming to the restaurant. Needless to say we will not return.

Food looks good and taste terrible. It was no seasoning at all. The portions were small and definitely not worth the price. My Food arrived cold. the short rib should at least give you one nice sized piece seemed like it was a piece taken out of the Salisbury steak box of a TV dinner. Fried green tomatoes had no taste smh if you’re a foodie like me this is definitely not it.

Absolutely loved. The staff was awesome and made me feel very welcome. Great explanation of food and drinks. Food was seasoned to perfection..especially the catfish. Short ribs were so tender. Very pleased. Sat outside on the patio area but the area was very crowded so wish I would've chose inside instead. That's just a tip if you are looking for something more private cause outdoors with people constantly walking by and loud cars..anyway that didn't take away from the restaurant. Would definitely return. Warning on busy weekends parking is almost impossible so may be best to uber/lyft
This place was AMAZING! the service and the food was nothing short of amazing Taylor and Manny are amazing servers who gave great service!
Nice and cozy atmosphere. Great service and very delicious food.
The food was amazing, the service was fantastic, the atmosphere was even better! I highly recommend this Hyde Park gem!

The food is incredible the service is fantastic they are friendly and if you don't mind action it is located in the middle of everything right around the corner from the movie theater I will however warn you, you better save your pennies because it cost to be the boss at this restaurant I will say that you won't be upset at the quality of the meal you paid for but you will have to start saving for your next visit
Very good food and great service outdoors.
Good food and service
Great food and outstanding service! Highly recommended.

The food was absolutely amazing! From the cocktail, the short prime rib, cornbread, Mac and cheese, and banana pudding. The service was great and friendly.  The atmosphere was so enjoyable. Really recommend it!! Will definitely go back.

My 1st experience here was a pleasant experience overall. I was seated promptly (reservations had been prearranged), and our waiter came over to greet us right away. I didn't like how only bottled water was placed on our tables but no drinking glasses, odd. Then a young lady comes over to my table and asks what the name was on my reservation. That was kind of a put off, but whatever, no big deal I guess. I ordered the shrimp and grits, honey butter cornbread, and mac n cheese. The shrimp left much to be desired, they tasted quite fishy and cheap (best way to describe). Like those mini shrimps you'd buy somewhere like Aldi or something. The grits were cooked correctly though. That cornbread is the devil! Omg so good as well as the mac. For the price of the cocktails I'd expect a standard sized drink and not a kiddie cocktail, which is exactly what they serve you (I see what you all did there). The ambiance was nice and the music was good. Fine dining and/or upscale is not what this establishment is, but I'll give it 3 stars for my overall experience, I may visit again.
Great food and friendly staff! One of my favorite places to eat. Not to mention the large portions for an affordable price.
Went here for the first time to celebrate my mom bday & the food was great. Especially the cornbread with the honey butter! Will definitely come back again. 😊
Excellent first time at here! The pork chop and shrimp entrees were incredible and paired well with our drinks. We’ll be returning soon for delicious soul food.

Review for my first and second visit:  First visit - I had a wonderful brunch here, but the prices can add up QUICKLY if you're not careful lol. Good service, good food, great music, and a comfortable atmosphere. The decor is beautiful! I went for the first time on Sunday. I ordered the shrimp and geechie boy cheddar grits with a side of biscuits. The biscuits were brought out first and they were so good! The butter and preserve that's served with it made a great addition. As for the shrimp and grits, the shrimp were large and plentiful and the grits were nice and creamy! It didn't have any overwhelming sauce that many places smother onto their shrimp and grits, which I LOVED! For drinks, I ordered 1 mimosa and 1 bellini. They were okay, will try the Bloody Southerner next time. All together my bill was $47...those darn drinks lol. But this place is pricey in general...almost all of the side items are $6, which I don't agree with. Eggs or a single sausage patty should not cost $6.  Update from today’s visit 7/23 — I ordered the shrimp and grits again today and unfortunately was highly disappointed. It was like it was a completely different dish! The grits were no longer creamy, they were runny. I didn’t like the sauce used in the dish and it had an unfitting spiciness to it. It didn’t even LOOK appealing. I also ordered the honey butter cornbread, which was the only thing I enjoyed. It’s amazing. Get that. I doubt they’ll risk compromising that recipe, everyone orders it.
Great experience and food even during a pandemic. Thanks for making this experience remarkably pleasant. 5 ⭐️
Food is very good; service is slow. Also they overcharged me for a drink (they fixed it when I pointed it out, but)
Definitely worth the drive from downtown. Wife and I went there for brunch and would definitely return (and would love to try their dinner menu). Southern favorites with a twist!
Greens are great

I found them very accommodating and the staff were excellent. The food was unbelievably delicious. I definitely want to come back after they’ve expanded the menu. Great experience, wonderful atmosphere, and fantastic wine list too. Can’t wait to return!! Also Freddy is the best ❤️ he made sure we had the best recommendations and treated us well.  Support your local businesses, people!

We decided to go to Virtue this weekend after visiting Promontory Point. It was incredibly good. We got the pork chop, catfish, mac and cheese and pudding. Everything was 5 star quality! I will definitely be stopping in every time I'm on Hyde Park.

I’m only leaving one star because it isn’t possible to leave zero.My friend and I were told that we were being refused service but weren’t  given an explanation as to why. Horrible customer service. They told us we don’t feel comfortable serving you. My friends had been raving about this place , how it was black owned and us wanting to support black owned business we decided to go. Bad idea!! I’m really flabbergasted at the treatment we received. Will never go back.
Absolutely amazing!!! Food and service was incredible!

Consistently one of the best restaurants in Chicago. Great vegetable dishes including small plates, large plates, and sides. Also excellent seafood and meat options. Do yourself a favor and get the gizzards to start.

I’ve been waiting for over 40mins for a pickup that I ordered online 5 days ago. I was told it was ready than after waiting an additional 20mins I had to ask “is my food ready, I was told it was done,” then the guy says I thought it was ready. Why did I have to ask him ? Bad customer service
Best restaurant in Chicago right now, in my opinion.  Every single dish delivers 110%.

Great experience on a very busy evening. We placed a takeout order inside the restaurant for catfish, cornbread and gumbo. The gentleman who took our order could not have been more gracious. Our food was quickly prepared, and was delicious. Great service and food during a challenging time.

Absolutely amazing local black-owned restaurants here in Hyde Park. One of my favorite places to go whether it's for a special date or just feeling like having excellent food for the entire family. They have adapted to the new normal and offer both take out and Patio service. We literally just got takeout a second time and it was even better. Highly recommend the short ribs and the pork chops!!!

(Translated by Google) Very good restaurant I quite like this place it has excellent customer service I quite like this place, very good the food it is, without a doubt very good the restaurant very nice decoration that this place has very good indeed  (Original) Muy buen restaurante me gusta bastante este sitio tiene un excelente servicio al cliente me gusta bastante este lugar , muy buena la comida que esta , sin duda alguna muy bueno el restaurante muy bonita decoracion que tiene este lugar muy bueno por cierto
You and your staff are made of gold. Love your efforts.
Their tg sunday family dinner was ok, good, but the salad was strange. Just iceberg lettuce literally.

The service & food was delicious.  We had the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer & it was a lovely treat.  Red beans & rice & catfish was the main entree,  large enough to share so we did.  Rose' was the cocktail of choice & it too was great.  Overall great experience,  awesome food just a lil pricey. I will return
Outstanding sophisticated southern comfort food and exceptional service.  Despite it being far from home, we’ll be back again and again.

The food was good, the staff was great...attentive & friendly! The atmosphere was nice and everyone seem to be enjoying themselves despite how crowded it was. I enjoyed my first visit.... looking forward to future visits!

We visited Virtue because I saw Erik on “Check Please” and felt very proud of this extraordinary black chef and all that he does mentoring aspiring chefs of the future.  Our party was very impressed with the ambiance and exceptional customer service.  The other patrons consisted of various cultures and a wide range of ages.  The wait staff served our meals as a team, meaning all courses were brought to our table hot and at the same time.  Our only surprise was the cost and portion size of each menu item, still we were exceptionally happy to support Erik and pray that Virtue will offer more lower priced/special menu items, maybe on a certain day and time and I will definitely frequent often .

This place is delicious! Not sure why it took us this long to finally come here for brunch. We finally did and OMG!  Biscuits and gravy was out of this world. Mind you it’s not the usual pork gravy, but it’s smoked turkey gravy. The chicken sausage was both sweet and savory. The cinnamon roll icing had a taste of sour cream and made it so tsty! All YUM! And the Bloody Virtue made this place, now, as my go-to spot for Bloody Mary!  Service was excellent, too. They were all very attentive. Water and coffee were never empty long and all were happy to help rather than the usual “not my table” attitude.  Only minor con is that it was quite noisy in here with the music being a bit loud (but I know it’s to drown out the conversations of the patrons due to the acoustic of the room). Not enough to dock even half a star, since my wife and I can hear each other no problem.

Our bartender was entertaining, I appreciate the ambience, cool vibe. Our waiter service no good, my food, red beans and rice, not good. Beans hard, no real flavor, brown rice undercooked. My daughter had shrimp & grits. It was tasty along with the biscuits and buffalo cheese bites. They are pricey, 19 plus tax for the plate of beans and rice, not worth the price. This establishment is worth a try at least once. I wouldn’t go out my way to visit.

Southern menu. The greens were awesome. The Mac and cheese was awesome. The corn bread was good but average. The chicken was awesome. The brisket was awesome. The salmon was good but a little bit too "fishy". Spent about $100. Service was great. Get reservations since the place is becoming more popular since the chef has gained widespread acclaim through popular magazines.
Great environment great food
Excellent food and drinks paired with delicious and strong cocktails. Service was attentive and the ambience is lovely.
My favorite Bib Gourmand.
The food was great!!!
My waiter was amazing, the manager was nice, chef was AGGRESSIVE.
Stopped by for brunch.  Great food.  Great service.  Virtue is a great addition to Hyde Park.
Really good southern cooking with a city twist. A must try if you're in Chicago.
Food and service outstanding and magnificent you have to come here

Great food but bad service. If you’re looking for a fine dining experience, this isn’t it. Waiter never said “excuse me”, just kept reaching around all of us. His demeanor wasn’t pleasant. He needed a different system for taking our orders as he was scrambling through 3 different sheets of paper trying to figure out what he wrote down and ended up missing several food items. Then he sent the manager to kick our group out because we were past time for the table, but the only reason we were still sitting there was because we were waiting on the dessert the server said was coming out. I would’ve preferred to just have the young man who seemed to be going through training with the server as he was much friendlier with clearly some prior experience in dining. If you just want good food and don’t care about the frills, then you’ll have a great time here.
The food taste mediocre
THE BEST MAC AND CHEES I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!
Cocktails very well made, dinner was excellent,  we had the short ribs with sides of collard greens, mac and cheese and the grits. I can't wait to go back!
Great food, very very dark lighting....BUT I LIKED IT
Excellent service and awesome food. The short ribs were perfect as was the gumbo, shrimp and grits and banana pudding. Our server, Alex, could not have been more lovely.
EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!! NO COMPLAINTS.  YOU MAY WAIT A WHILE EVEN THOUGH YOU HAVE RESERVATIONS
Great food, great service, thanks Dave and all who made it a great experience.

This is an absolute must stop when you're in Chicago. The service is out of this world. Warm, friendly, very happy servers. The food is better than homemade. Rib tips that literally fall into bite size pieces at the touch of your fork. Gizzards that are crisp, but tender. Catfish seasoned to perfection & so much more. This is my first visit, but not my last.
Can't wait to come back!

Great brunch! We'd been here for dinner before, but never had the brunch. First off, I recommend checking your coat. It's free and the dining room is tight with little hanging space. We had the cinnamon roll and coffee cake to start. Cinnamon roll was delicious, icing not overly sweet, coffee cake was warm in the middle. This was the Sunday after Valentine's day, so my girl had a mimosa and I had the Bloody Mary. The Mary has hot sauce and Cajun kind of spices in it. Unique and good. I had the brioche and ham for my main course and she had the biscuits and gravy. The ham brioche is out of this world and the gravy had shredded smoked turkey in it. We'll definitely be back.
Some of the best food I've ever had, hands down.

Food was very good. However the restaurant charged us $150 as a deposit then forgot to take it off the bill.  Also had multiple issues contacting them to update reservation; was put on hold for over 30 minutes, twice.
First rate. A must try in Hyde Park. Succulent servings, stellar service, great vibe, what's not to like?
Great food but very rude host staff. Be aware they will rush you to eat, pay, and leave. Even when you just sat down.

Lovely meal and service at Virtue, as expected. Although crowded, my friends and I were able to get a table without a reservation late Sunday night. Cocktails were great, refreshing and strong (I highly recommend Justify and Georgia Peach). For food, a couple of us got appetizers (called small rations on the menu) and a couple got entrees. The appetizers are great for sharing but can be enough as a small dinner entree. Everything we tried--the gumbo, green tomatoes, pork chop (huge!), and short ribs (so tender!) were cooked perfectly and presented beautifully.  Service was warm and friendly, and I appreciated that they brought everything out at the same time for us. The ambiance is elevated but still has a local neighborhood feel to it, and the decor feels both rustic and posh. Virtue is truly a gem in Hyde Park and I'll be back for more!
Food, ambiance, service, all great!!!

Came there Saturday night with a group of 8 ladies. We had a table reserved. Tight space  but the food and drinks was delicious. I had the Gumbo, corn bread, mac and cheese and a Hurricane drink. Lovely experience. Parking in Hyde Park is a 🤬.
Great brunch and wonderful service. Loved my shrimp Benedict.

Food was excellent!!! Restaurant atmosphere was very cozy. Food came promptly after ordering! The gizzards,  catfish and collards greens were to die for! And OMG the sweet potato pie was fantastic!  Effrin our server was fantastic!! The owner stopped by and thanked us for coming!
Top notch Southern food, in a friendly atmosphere.
Great dinner and my server was excellent.

The service was good for a large group. The food was very good. The drinks were good also. I had their salmon and biscuits. The sauce for the smoked salmon was really good. Their peach bellini is a little tart but still really good. Overall, I would definitely go back.
The service was top notch which in turn made the food that much better.
Very nice ambiance and delicious food
Best brunch I've had in years

Erick Williams has done something special with his recipes, the food is delicious.  The bar is nicely equipped with large televisions for the games. Make sure to visit this spot next time your in Hyde Park.

How do they do it?  How do they manage to cook the pork chop to perfection? The pork chop I had was so tender and flavorful. I wondered if it was a fluke. Well, the answer is NO! Each time I went back to Vitrue and ordered the pork chop I was not disappointed. Thank you, Chef!
Food was just amazing and David was polite and patient with our questions and requests...thank you David!
Great food and great service!

Excellent upscale soul food restaurant. What you would expect in Hyde Park- traditional facorites w/modern twists, delicious but healthy, upscale but casual. Went for brunch. Blanca was a great waitress. Coffee cake was delicious. If you ask them to make pulled pork and egg like chorizo con huevos you WILL get dirty looks. jk, really Nice  people.

The ambience is beautiful, the staff very friendly and attentive to it's customers, the food was OK gumbo did not taste like gumbo it was more like a stew and the fried green tomatoes was sliced too thick, but its seasoning was OK.
Great experience. Tasty soul food.

Hands down, one of the best restaurants in Chicago.  If you like true gourmet Southern cuisine, this place is a must.  Erick Williams is a true artist.  The NYE five course meal is perfect, especially with someone special.  Service is top notch as well.  Hyde Park has truly arrived with Virtue.

Two weeks ago, myself and a friend went in, the restaurant of course being full, we were seated at the high table. The waiter was amazing, the food was something to behold, it was literally perfect. Because of my amazing first time experience, I went again tonight for girls night, I reserved a table, we came and because the entire party was not there we had to wait until the person showed, our reservations were for 6, however we could be seated until 6:30, that was no problem I understood  that. As we were going to our table, the lady seating states.....we have a party that reserved this table at 8, and then asked her does that mean we have to leave by 8, she says yes.....I have never been to a restaurant that tells people you can have your table for 2 hours......I than asked the manager because I have been to the top restaurants in chicago, never heard such a thing. The manager in his words states "because we want to give everyone  the best experience we feel that 2 hours is enough time for everyone to eat and enjoy-mind you it took the waitress 30min. to come with our drinks-, he then reinstated we have a party at 8 which reserved this table, I then stated so are you telling me we only had 2 hours to eat and socialize. I COULD NOT BELEIVE A RESTAURANT COULD TELL SOMEONE YOU HAVE 2 hours and then you must leave for the next party, by this time me and my friends felt they did not need our money, we paid for our drink, they double charged us then told us we were short, even though everyone had there individual bill, and I personally gave the waitress a bigger tip because we were leaving.......we ended up going to Mesler, had a blast, and when I asked the waitress at Mesler was there a 2 hour limit she looked at me like I was crazy and stated "no mam we would never make someone get up after they have sat down."..... The food at virtue is amazing, however telling people they have 2 hours to eat is very disrespectful.

The wine list is inclusive not exhaustive, capturing varieties of regions and grapes. Each dish is spectacular, with each having a bit of complexity or complimented perfectly. There is no doubt that this restaurant will be in heavy rotation. Five flames are necessary to properly rate.
Food is Great
(Translated by Google) My restaurant in Chicago 😋  (Original) Mi restaurante en Chicago 😋
Love the food and staff.

What an amazing place in Hyde Park! Come here for some Southern inspired food and a romantic environment. First timers should definitely try the blackened catfish and pair it with a side of delicious cornbread and yummy Mac and cheese! The shrimp and grits were also very tasty.
Virtue was awesome!!! I truly enjoyed my experience.
Restaurant lived up to all the hype. Amazing food, great cocktails, cool ambience. Will be back. Great restaurant to visit before or after Museum of Science and Industry too!

Was there for Sunday brunch.  The food was superb. I can’t stress that enough.  The staff was friendly.  The space like most spaces in desirable Chicago neighborhoods is too small for the number of patrons.  But still had an enjoyable experience.

Very clean. 3.5-4 star cuisine, soul infusion...very impressive presentations of dishes and moderately attentive staff. Great bar, darkly lit at night so if vision impaired bring glasses. Not many items of vegan or dairy free variety.  Excellent decor.
Pleasant. Nice. Tasty

One of the best dinners of the last few months. High quality food on very normal prices. Small variety of dishes which makes choice easier. Southern comfort food. The desserts were spectacular. Local and cozy.
Cool Vibe, Great Service, Amazing Food
Wonderful atmosphere.... elevated southern cuisine with impeccable service
Everything tasted good.

Me and my girls had dinner with friends here and the food was absolutely delicious! It is a blend of upscale southern cuisine!  We all ordered different dishes to ensure we had a taste of all the flavors... Cornbread/Catfish/Chicken/Salmon/Shrimp and Cheddar Grits
Fundamental food incredible cocktails and fabulous service
Great short ribs . Gumbo was so good, but needed a little more rice. Front greeting was a little dry; we had to initiate conversation. 5 stars are for the great food and excellent service.
Excellent service and the food was cooked to perfection

Phenomenal food, even better service. The staff are all very warm and inviting. Everything we ate was amazing, but I liked the half chicken and the Mac and cheese the best. I can’t speak highly enough of the staff. Our host, Jesus, went above and beyond to make sure we would be able to make a later engagement. Highly recommended.

Definitely worth the drive from downtown. Went there for brunch and would definitely return (and would love to try their dinner menu). Southern favourites with a modern flair. The Bloody Mary that accompanied my brunch was killer!
Fantastic contemporary southern inspired cuisine. Such a wonderful atmosphere, bring your family and friends

We stopped by here for brunch during Open House Chicago and had the best time. The food was delicious (shrimp and grits!!!), the staff was wonderful (they were able to accommodate vegetarian food restrictions) and the ambiance was super chill and comforting at the same time. I can’t wait to come back here for another meal!
The service is good, the prices are reasonable, and parking can be difficult. The dishes can be great or alright nothing consistent.

The food was incredible, all the suggestions of the waiter were great. The atmosphere is really good and the attention is astounding. The prices are fair and they charge for what you are gonna get. It really worths it!!!

I wonder if these reviews matter, but here goes. This restaurant is absolutey adorable. The atmosphere is wonderful and the food is devine. I love this place. I'm somewhat of a Chef myself so, I must say the food keeps me going back. Just call me the female Anton Ego, for those of you who has seen the movie Ratatouille. Anyway, like I said the food is devine. The service is pretty good, I hope it stays that way. But, the front where the Hostesses are when you first enter, to me sort of unprofessional. It was my daughter's birthday and she really wanted to go because I had hyped it up so much!!! But the hostess, who did not smile when she saw us enter. She was polite, however letting us know that there was a 7:15 reservation, and we would have to be quick about our eating. This bothered me so bad and kind of messed up my daughter's birthday and her first experience there. The manager, Jesus came to our table to speak with us about the problem that I had with the hostess. He apologized, but they really need to watch that. They don't know who a person is, or who they know. I really am taken back by that, so not too sure I'll go back, but we'll see

Philip Davis here. I am something of a "Down Home, Old Style" Southern Cooking Afficionao. This Restaurant, Virtue, was truly a pleasure. The Wait Staff is extraordinarily pleasant and competent. The Food is both  wonderful and plentiful. My Companion had the Chicken and Waffles and he, as a Native of Mississippi, was delighted. I, Northern City Boy to the Core but born of Southern Parents, had the Shrimp, Cheese Grits, and Egg; they were among the Best that I have ever had. The Ambience of the Rooms was quite balanced; there was Little Noise from Other Customers' Tables. My Guest and I even had an Opportunity to meet . the Owner, Mr. Williams, a Highly Personable Man. My Only Complaint--and it is a Small One--is that the Restaurant is just a bit pricey. Oh, well. One cannot have everything. I highly recommend Virtue Restaurant to one and all. You will enjoy it. Philip Davis, PhD
Great ambiance

This was my first time at Virtue and I was very impressed.  I was here for a private event but nonetheless I was able to check out the specialty dishes and get a chance to meet the Chef/Owner Eric. The food is delicious,  the staff makes you feel like royalty and I will definitely be back to check the rest of the menu. You will not be disappointed.
Great service, good food, nice atmosphere! $$$
This is one of those great places that you did not know about. I love this neighborhood and places like this keep me coming back again and again. Staff is amazingly friendly.
Great service, Friendly ambience, excellent southern cuisine.

A very friendly host welcomed the four of us warmly as we stepped out of the rain into the restaurant. Our friends ordered drinks and we inquired about whether non-alcoholic beer was available. The server checked and came back to say no, but the restaurant would offer it in the future. (Yes!) We started our dinner with fried green tomatoes served with shrimp, which we all agreed were delicious. We also shared two orders of biscuits and cornbread with pimento cheese. The biscuits are really fabulous, drizzled with a little honey and served with soft butter. Yum. I ordered salmon and our friends had the catfish and a steak special. Everything was well-prepared and very tasty.
Tasty food, good atmosphere.
Great food & excellent service.
More fancy than good

Such a great addition to the neighborhood! I’ve been here for dinner 5 times in the last 3 months. The food is always delicious and the wait staff is great. My only compliant is that the front of the house has always been strangely unfriendly.
Mac and cheese, cornbread, everything!

This is the finest southern cuisine I've had in the Midwest. In this time of divisiveness it's wonderful seeing such a diverse group of diners coming together under one roof to celebrate food that emulates the spirit of America. First class service, nice decor and the chef's vision makes for a wonderful gourmet experience.
Great staff and veggies/apps, the entrees were underwhelming.
Food is excellent.  BAR outstanding.  Limited menu.
The food is incredible.
It's about time
Great place good food I love it
Good food, great waiters . They have vegetarian offerings .

1st time visiting with two friends for dinner...our entire experience was wonderful.  One of the first things we noticed as we were seated, besides the super-modern, comfortable decor was that the open kitchen was in the same room as us.  Super-friendly staff beginning with the beautiful women who greeted us, the gentleman who poured our water, to Taylor, our ever-attentive & knowledgeable server!  Her recommendations certainly helped to make our culinary journey one to remember: from the "gem lettuce" & "green tomatoes"(& shrimp) appetizer, to the salmon, beef short ribs & pork chop entrees, then "millie's puddin' (banana) & warm peach cobbler for dessert...whew!!  Our tummies are full of great food, we enjoyed great conversation in a very inviting (& busy) space. Thank you Virtue family for taking such great care of us tonight...CHEERS!
Great food and even greater service!
Great food, ambiance and wait staff

I really appreciate the environment that I eat in is really clean great staff love with the owner Eric walks around and says hello people come from all over the world seated as restaurant my family come from Atlanta Texas and Miami to visit me and I always recommend this restaurant my name is sharoncarney and I had a great meal last night
The food and service was excellent!!
The catfish was great, the mac and cheese was fantastic. Service was prompt, friendly, and attentive. I loved the cocktails, the southern summer was my favorite. It is a little pricey though
"Wonderful establishment with Great food, good drinks and excellent service." Love it! #Shopwhereyolifematters Blu of BLUtintphotography
The food is stunning!
Very personable. Simple but elegant.
Delicious Southern classics in a modern presentation and awesome signature drinks. Make sure you meet Chef/owner Erick, he's a cool cat!
The ambiance was great. Sat at the bar, had tremendous service and the food was fantastic! Really impressed... went there when it was A10. Without a doubt, it has improved.

Virtue was undoubtedly good. Each dish was well though out and built with intention. The menu is short but flavor-diverse to satisfy any craving.  We had their cinnamon role, biscuits and gravy, and ... a gruyer sandwich which I honestly forgot what it was called.  Everything was delightful and I am curious to come back for dinner. My only complaint would be that all the food came out 10-15 degrees to cold which prevented the food from reaching its full flavor potential.
Reminds me of food I had when I visited the South. Would love to go again

The biscuits here are amazing! The gizzards, had a touch of spice and the catfish dry rub was there best thing! The beef short ribs were so tender you didn't need a knife, just pulled apart. Grab a cocktail or two, bar tenders are wonderful
Food is perfect. Needs to speed up service.

I had the chicken and andouille gumbo,  it was really good! I have to admit I didn't choose anything else but nothing seemed appetizing.  The menu was pretty limited but the server said it changes with each season. The restaurant was pretty dark but we felt like we received good service,  I suggest some live entertainment on Thursday nights!

I started  eating  here  and the service  and food  matched  the quality   of the word   ...now meh  not so much  the service  was shabby  the drink was tart  food was  misserved  i guess if that's a word   jus bad
Cant say enough good things about this restaurant. Great food and awesome bartenders. Downtown ambiance without going downtown.
Great food and customer service!!!
Excellent food and service.
Food and drinks were great.👍
Everything was great. Service was wonderful, and the salmon... omg.
Fun place with nice atmosphere. Some dishes were excellent (catfish, cornbread, biscuits, mac & cheese) while others were average (pork chop and chicken). Large portions. Very loud. Nice staff.

Finally made it in to try them. Not overly impressed.  The wait was fine. It was a busy Saturday night. The atmosphere was loud and it did make it hard to hear my waiter. I ordered the salmon. My daughter ordered the chicken. The amount of vegetables only plate were non existent. The plating was nice but where were my veggies? The piece of salmon for the $27 approx price tag was small. I had to send my drink back because it was bitter instead of sweet. I ordered the southern summer. It has agave in it but I couldn't taste any. My replacement drink was fine. My daughters plate had plenty of chicken but was also lacking on a decent ratio of veggies. We ordered a side of cornbread and greens. Too many stems in the greens and the cornbread was dense and hard. It reheated better than it was served hot out of the oven. (Tip... serve the butter on the side) All and all..... $100 bill later.... will I return..  maybe if I was meeting friends.  I was disappointed on some levels and pleased on others. My waiter was Tahar and he was awesome. I made sure to tip him well for such wonderful service. Also... a tip for the owner... dont chew out your wait staff in the middle of the night. It affects them mentally and makes it hard to work and serve with a pleasant demeanor.  Also... I should not have been privy to watch it go down.

Food was excellent/outstanding. Chef did a great job. Banana pudding is the best we have ever had. We ordered all of the Small Rations. Each was delicious. Bathroom stall smelled like urine. Waitress could use training. We will definitely return. Worth the trip from Evanston.
Great food! Great atmosphere!

A friend of my mine had a birthday dinner at virtue. It was a great time. I had the gumbo and cornbread. The cornbread was delicious. The gumbo was just enough (could have used more rice). The ambiance was idea for a celebration.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because the appetizer menu was a little more appealing than the main course menu.
Amazing food will have to make sure entire family experience it

This place is amazing! We ordered beets, half chicken, cauliflower and cornbread. The beets were OK… it's cold, I prefer warm beets… the half chicken, corn bread and cauliflower were all very delicious. The chicken esp was very juicy. The slightly sweet sides of squash and tomato relish suited the chicken spice well. The atmosphere is classy yet relaxing. If you would like to wear shorts while chatting about astrophysics or Inca empire, you may like this place.

This restaurant is amazing, the service is exceptional!! The fried green tomatoes is a must for a starter. The pork chop is so juicy and big enough to share, the short ribs are so tender and flavorful. The collard greens is a must, I am not a big fan of greens but I can eat the greens at Virtue everyday. The flavor is divine. The justify cocktail is a nice refreshing drink. Lastly the banana pudding is a nice end to an amazing meal.

The food at Virtue was excellent, each dish we tried was better than the one that came before it. Also our waitress took the time to give us very good explanations about the size of each dish. Overall, an amazing experience.
Amazing food and excellent staff. I highly recommend the mac and cheese.
Food was excellent. The   ambiance is beautiful. If its your first time visiting the restaurant the owner comes out to greet you. I would go again and again for this wonderful experience.

Virtue in Hyde Park wonderfully located in the heart of Hyde Park This restaurant came recommended by a friend.... We were greeted by a warm receptionist,  and Handsome.Mr Williams owner/master chef greeted us as well. He was very attentive but did not hover over us. Our wait time was reasonable. The waitress was pleasant and informative the food was upscale classy and soulfully delicious. I enjoyed the cornbread, half of chicken with a side of Lima beans,  Macaroni and cheese and forkfuls of my sister’s braised short ribs so Yummie, made to order fresh. Class-A Atmosphere we will be back again and again!!!
Food was amazing and all your waiters were kind. Great costumer service. Great atmosphere.
Over priced and unimpressive
Excellent service from a restaurant that made this their mission. (Good and drink we exceptional too!)
Nice atmosphere. The food is pretty good
Excellent food and great service!
Best soul food in town with a very capable wait staff
Loved it

The ambiance was very welcoming! We sat at the bar and enjoyed our drinks and appetizers. The fried green tomatoes were food but I prefer a lighter batter! Freddy the bartender was very attentive and nice! I will definitely go back!
Delicious, attentive service! Tasty southern soul food.

We visited based on thebrave reviews in the news and on tv. The space is cozy and very very tight. There's always a chance that someone is going to bump your seat if you have that aisle seat due to the tight walkways. We had the fried green tomatoes they were a bit too ripe, the shrimp and grits for the most part were nothing special and the seasoning seemed as though it varied shrimp to shrimp like they forgot to season them all at the same time. I did try the banana pudding that was raved about and was not impressed.

We had a great experence, where foodies and our taste buds enjoyed all of it. The flavor was great also service is top notch! Will be back. And we drive from northwest suburbs to try this wonderful resturant Nd worth it!
I like the atmosphere and the servers.
Great chef driven take on southern food...highly recommended...

My first time here and the place is very nice and live... Great energy and the staff was very attentive!!! I had the chicken and waffles which were excellent ❤ .... Will definitely be returning to this establishment!!!

Delectable Southern cuisine & superb customer service. The hostess Azizi was a special treat! Very impressed & proud of this establishment. My party had lima beans, shrimp & grits, collard greens, cornbread & mac & cheese. Everything was DE-LI-CIOUS!!😋
The food and service was great..I give them a 4 star.
Good comfort food. Nice cocktails.
Modern soul food in a trendy setting.
Highly Recommended!!!

Virtue was an absolutely gorgeous restaurant with a spacious and well-appointed interior that takes nearly every point of contemporary dining and executed it flawlessly.  The mixture of china your grandmother may have used with a modernist bowl offsetting it and beautiful tones of grey, white and beige, subway tiles and stainless steel make it a truly beautiful space almost equally divided between the bar salon and the main dining room.  It is full of light and full of class with comfortable seating and an open kitchen.  The hours on the front should be updated to reflect brunch service which is the meal I chose for dining.  Judging by how quickly the dining room filled, it is a place where folks want to be seen dining as the crowd was diverse and everyone looked quite fashionable.  Virtue is clearly a place with great potential but it runs the risk of forgetting what is most important in a dining space, the food must be executed well and taste great in order to sustain its growth and popularity.  Now begins the critical part, as wonderful a space as this restaurant presents, the food and preparation are where it needs the most improvement.  These are the not-so-hard questions I had to ask myself...how do you overcook a waffle in a "chicken and waffle" dish and not prepare another one and do nothing to make it pop, no garnish, no sauce just a piece of chicken plopped on an overdone waffle?  How do you have "tortillas and pork" which lists cheddar cheese as an important ingredient but you do not melt the cheese properly?   The best item I ordered was the crunchy french toast with the banana pudding, banana slices and nilla wafer crumble which was plated nicely and almost as decadent as a dessert for breakfast.  The rescue of the tortillas and pork with a biscuits and salmon dish helped make a recovery.  The server was informative and helped to balance our rocky table, she was clearly experienced and attentive.  The restrooms are also nice with pocket doors and a gorgeous image of the Queen of Soul.   My last pet peeve was the blaring of the gospel music just a tad bit too high.  With many hard surfaces it can take away from the meal and should be ambient and complementary not cacophonic.
Mac & cheese is excellent! Enjoyed the fried green tomatoes. Service was very good.

First time dinning at Virtue inspite of the great reviews, this was not my experience. Some friends and I had an 8:30 reservation we were 10min early waited 20min to be seated another 30min to eat. Other customers who came after us were seated given drinks laughing enjoying their meal. If not for my girlfriend and my friends who accompanied us I would have left. Our waitress admitted she was new but... her poor service was not an excuse. I did speak with the manager who  offered his apologies and extended 2 complimentary desserts that he chose but, we  didn't care for. On a positive note the food was delicious.... THAT, they got right! Would I go back undecided. I have a hard time paying for bad service, regardless to how good the meal was. 2 stars is all I got but.... that chef gets 5.
Great food and service.

A great vibe. Unfortunately twice in a row we have had to wait more than 40 minutes for our reservation! Even so... You walk out being surprised how little you paid for a good meal. One of the popular wines, horseshoes and handgrenades, is off menu but fabulous. Some of the dishes are excellent: the mushrooms; the shrimp and grits; the beef short ribs. Others are simply fine, like the broccoli, squash, or catfish. The sides (mac and cheese, collard greens) manage to be disappointing in the same way that so many BBQ joint sides are disappointing. Overall a solid place and a fabulous addition to the Hyde Park scene.
The chef isn't afraid of seasonings,  the cheese, shrimp grits with  cajun gravy, cornbread, greens, braised Brussels sprouts and gumbo! All excellent! The bartenders tend to your palate
Great food, a bit busy but worth it.
The food was delicious. I will definitely visit again.
Love the ambiance.  The gumbo was delicious but VERY soupy, with only about 1 TB rice.  My glass of wine was small, and visibly less than my tablemate's.
Great food, great service...

I really liked this place. It can be a little crowded and loud. (I got the back of my head bumped by someone but I wasn't sure if it was staff coming from the back or another customer walking through.) Get the collard greens, shrimp and grits, green tomatoes, and coconut mousse desert. The ham and hoghead cheese plate was pretty good too. The honey butter on the cornbread was an interesting combo, like if regular corn bread and jiffy cornbread had a baby. If I'm in the area this place would be considered again.
Authentic Southern style food. Get the friend green tomatoes & banana pudding 👌🏻
Excellent new American food, with southern and latino influences. The collard greens are quite salty. Prices are reasonable, portions are a bit on the small side.
Great food must have a reservation
Gumbo was salty, blacken catfish was good, cornbread excellent
The best restaurant I've eaten at in the last year. Virtue takes comfort food to the extreme. The best macaroni and cheese on Earth!
Good food great service.  Tasty cocktails $$$$
This is a very nice restaurant, waitress and waiters are great and the food is really good I give it five stars!

My family of 18 was there Saturday, March 30 for a Birthday celebration and ALL of us enjoyed the food, friendly staff and great ambience. I highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be back..#cornbreadwithhoneybutter #greentomatoeswithshrimp

It was my bday wow that place packed with people upscale.... The Food was delicious and the waitress so friendly they accommodated the party of 4 which became 5.... We loved that and the main Chef/ Owner came to our Table delighted us for my bday and was very nice... We had ice cream which was simply delicious.. We will definitely return... The dim lights makes the astomphere so romantic and comfortable..A many thanks to everyone there... Big portions of food! Fried Green Tomatoes to Die For!

Good food, great energy! Nice place for a family dinner, group of friends, or a quaint party of one. The mac and cheese is delish and so is the gumbo. Cornbread and butter... Yum! Oh, the salmon is pretty good, too. Very nice establishment.
Great food, good drinks and excellent service.

I ate here once and I don't know too much about it otherwise, but I enjoyed a late dinner on a Friday. The atmosphere was great. Low key, a little romantic but not stuffy. The staff was professional and pleasant. Our server was funny and made us feel welcome and relaxed.  The interior is very nice, well designed and not pretentious! The menu was very good. I had the fried green tomatoes. They were excellent! My entree was a wild mushroom dish, cooked perfectly.  The cocktails we're ok. The menu doesn't accurately list all ingredients and I ended up with a very sweet cocktail when I was hoping for one without sugar added.  The issues I had that kept me from 5 stars was the cocktail menu being unclear and missing ingredients, that I was brought the wrong cocktail initially (but still charged for it), and the fried green tomatoes we're ridiculously hot and burned my mouth, leaving it sore for a week! I'll be back definitely, and I hope they can iron out those tiny wrinkles! Definitely try this place, especially for a post-9pm dinner. I wasn't disappointed.

The mac and cheese was terrible; dry and tangy....fried green tomatoes  we're good  the collard greens  don't come with cornbread  you have to purchase that separately  which I've never seen at a soul food restaurant portion size was to small for price....

Virtue has been open for just a few months and it already feels like it is Hyde Park's "must visit".  Our party of 10 was seated in the ample bar area where the scene was a mix of upscale comfort and an interactive buzz.  It is an authentically southern restaurant and our table enjoyed the gumbo, fried green tomatoes and "butcher's snack"  for appetizers and each helped to set the mood.  My short rib entree was amazingly meaty, nearly cut with a fork tender and expertly seasoned.  Its a gem of a restaurant that's likely to become a landmark.  Congratulations!
This place is amazing! I had the broccoli and corn bread and everything about it was delicious. I was afraid I wasn’t going to be full after eating but I was definitely satisfied.
The food is delicious and service is very good! The chef is very pleasant and personally greets his guests, which is a nice touch. A welcome addition to the Hyde Park community.

Went here for the 1st time on a date. Very nice intimate set up. The hostesses were very kind and patient since we didnt have a reservation which def should be done. Micah (I think) was our server and the reason I didnt give 5 stars. He was very impatient and explained most of the items the on the menu simply as "good" or based on details that the menu already elaborated. Asked him detail about the dill butter on the salmon and he explained it as it being cooked in dill butter. Def was not the case. The food was delicious but I wish the dill butter (or dill puree) was explained better so I could of had it removed entirely. I'd def revisit again for another experience.
Great food and service!
Highly recommend making a reservation... the wait is well worth it.. the food was exceptionally delicious! A must to experience in the Hyde Park Area!

High end down home Southern food. Gumbo (chicken/andouille) is dark and rich but a tad salty. Greens were delicious as was Berkshire double pork chop with apple glaze. Blackened catfish with dirty rice also tasty. Service was attentive and informative. Knocked off one star for deafeningly loud dining room. Go on a weeknight to actually hear your companion.
Good food and ambiance will visit again
Delicious food, great service
Food is very, very, good!!!!!!!
I so enjoy Virtue...good food..great drinks....friendly knowledgeable service...cool ambience..pay street parking and valet parking..pay city lot around the corner
Great food and service.

Decided to stop by for a couple drinks while passing by on a Friday evening around 7:30. The environment in the bar area is fantastic - dimly lit and soul music in the background. There's about 12 seats at the bar and 12 or so tables. The bar stayed pretty full throughout the evening but there was a steady flow in and out so there weren't a lot of people standing.  The folks working behind the bar were great and the service was what you'd hope for in a place like this. Michael was knowledgable, willing to make recommendations, and willing to chat and check in even as he was busy making drinks.  They had four seasonal cocktails on their menu and 8-10 others. They also have a nice wine list and a solid beer list (maybe 5-6 on tap and another 6-8 in bottles).  I went with a cocktail - the Baby's It's Cold Outside (seasonal). It's the  perfect seasonal cocktail - the rum providing some nice sweetness and that slightly-boozy-warming vibe that you want from a seasonal drink and the almond liqueur provides those earthy-warming-sitting-by-a-fire notes. A really nice drink.  I'll definitely be back. Can't wait to eat dinner here.  Edit: Came back for dinner Feb 2019. Loved it. Amazing food and great attentive service. A must do experience in the neighborhood.
Food was hit/miss. My drink was delicious but the food quality was inconsistent. Great appetizers, less than entrees
Amazing food!!!!!!!!
Delicious! A must visit. One of the best places for southern cuisine. The staff was very cordial and knowledgeable. Love the atmosphere. Keep up the great job! I will be back soon.
Nice service. Good food. Terrible parking

The food was very tasty! I ordered blackened catfish and greens seasoned with smoked turkey. The catfish entre was not very filling for the price, but I enjoyed the experience! The environment is friendly and classy, not too stuffy.

Celebrated my daughter's birthday on 2/17 and it was not a pleasant experience. The waitress we had was ABSOLUTELY horrible! She wasn't attentive, forgot silverware after bringing out my Gumbo..completely forgot to bring birthday cake with candle to table for my daughter. Food was just ok..definitely won't be returning. Very disappointed.

Classic food cooked well, but that's it. The dishes aren't very inspiring and the prices are a bit outrageous. I enjoyed the biscuits and the cocktails. I'd recommend this place for drinks and snacks only.

I really, really want this place to succeed. Please don't ever get complacent. Proper seasoning is mostly key to southern cuisine and my favorite fried green tomatoes require a batter of less flour, more corn meal seasoned with "lemon" pepper. Please try, thank you.

It was lacking. It is not a soul food joint of any type I remember. The food was bland and poorly seasoned The short ribs were lacking. They were cold. The greens were not from any southern tradition. The yams were few almost like a garnish. They were hard. The waiter talked to my wife and never looked at me when talking about the food as if I wasn't there. Aziza was the bright spot of our evening .SHE TRIED. to make things right and she was personable and sincere in her efforts. I may go back, but only if she is there.  The chocolate cake was very good.
Outstanding menu, delicious four course meal...the roast duck thigh was wonderful.

Good job, Virture! Small intimate spot, dim lighting and great craft cocktails. I wouldn't say this place is kid friendly tho'. The menu is a little sophisticated and the atmosphere is more grown and sexy. Highly recommend the Fried Green Tomatoes, Broccoli, Blackened Catfish and of course Mac-n-Cheese. I like it a lot considering dim lights can make anyone look good! :p
The food and service was great! Nice ambience as well. Would definitely recommend and return.
Delicious southern food and great specialty drinks in beautiful surroundings.

Went there for the first time two days ago. There was a long wait and we started not to stay. We are so glad we waited. Menu was different and trendy. Food was amazing!!! Staff is awesome! Will absolutely be back!

I would like to give this place 4.5 stars. My initial service at the bar was not the most impressive however once I was seated my waiter and the young man that served the water were excellent. My catfish was a too salty however when paired with sauce it was much better. The carrots and carolina gold rice were not memorable, both need more flavor. The mac and cheese and banana pudding were out of this world good. I spent around $50 after tip so it wont be a weekly visit but I will return for small plates, drinks, and dessert.
Attentive staff, savory cocktails,  delicious food.  The buiscuits are a must.

The energy and ambiance are awesome in this place. The food was excellent! I had the fried green tomatoes, blackened catfish, salmon, and banana pudding for dessert. THE BANANA PUDDING IS A MUST TRY!!! As a pescatarian, I am pretty particular about how my seafood is cooked and I was very impressed by the Catfish & Salmon. The servers were all very polite and professional. They did a great job of working together on a very busy night! All in all Mr. Williams has done a great job with this place!

Thanks chef Erick and staff for a fantabulous meal: crispy palate pleasing gem lettuce salad, most tender and delicious gizzards and dirty rice ever, cornbread and greens - WOW, and seriously on point chicken gumbo!! Special thank you to the entire wait staff and our server Lindsey.  We arrived late and still got a park directly across from the restaurant.  Will see you again soon (bringing the entire crew next time). - Carmencita, Charles and Bettie
Food was very tasty! Customer Service was very thoughtful and very versed on the entire menu! Special kudos to Daysi who was a very cool ROCKSTAR!

I had an outstanding experience here. The service was fast and attentive. I enjoyed the food. Actually this was the best macaroni and cheese that I have ever had at a restaurant. I woke up thinking about it. The atmosphere was intimate yet lively if you could imagine combining the two. I definitely will be returning.

Most upscale southern food I’ve had in a while. The food was good. The menu wasn’t too large, but enough to keep you satisfied.  The biscuits are a must have! The cornbread currently has a lot of social media coverage but  my vote goes to the biscuit. The pork chop is a very generous serving and delicious - the apple based sauce is the perfect touch to the pork. The broccoli is a great vegetable starter. And the Mac and cheese was ... greatness in cheddar cheesiness!  We walked in on a Thursday evening and waS seated right away in the bar area. The service was a touch slow, but friendly.

Nice ambiance and attentive staff ... food just wasn’t a wow for me.  On the plus side: * The macaroni and cheese was excellent and I am not a mac and cheese fan. * The gizzards were the most tender I’ve ever eaten — they tasted okay flavor wise.  On the okay side: *The chile-like chicken gumbo tasted OK—it could’ve used more rice. The chicken was chewy. *The 1/2 chicken with collards was OK the greens were flavorfully seasoned the chicken was unremarkable. *The seasonal eggnog cocktail was disappointing because it was tiny and not cold.  I would think a $12 milk-based drink would be cold or on ice.  The water wasn’t cold either.  Come to think of it I didn’t see ice anywhere in the place. *The pecan tart with pear slices was ok.  Overall: I don’t know if my palate is off or if I am not sophisticated enough but this dining experience wasn’t as elevated as I expected.

The food was spectacular! Service was A1 superb. I loved the salmon with the brussel sprouts.  The greens were delicious and one thing I would have never thought was good was the Lima beans, however, they were seasoned perfectly and taste delicious.  We will definitely return!
Amazing food and exceptional staff.

Loved this place! The interior is so beautiful, perfect for a date. It is a bit expensive but the food is really good and the portion was large enough for my husband and I to share. I definitely recommend!

The food and staff here were exceptional! We had the gizzards to start which were delicious! We then followed up with the chicken and the catfish plus a side of grits. More than anything though our waiter (José) made our evening!

Wonderful service, excellent food, the chef is sociable, courteous and professional. The gem salad...wow! The short ribs and mac n chesse... double wow! It's only been open for 12 days, but you gotta make those reservations! Already on the map! Excellent!
Awesome
Great joint
Great Service, Great Food, Great Experience...

We have been eagerly anticipating the opening of Virtue and we were lucky to attend on the first night of their soft opening - it was amazing! Every dish was superb, thoughtful and interesting. The service was truly outstanding. We are looking forward to our next visit.
